text: Josef Schäffer (born July 2, 1891 in Moravia) was an Austrian track and field athlete who competed in the 1912 Summer Olympics. He competed in the decathlon, shot put, discus throw and two-handed discus throw. He finished tenth in the decathlon, throwing the second-furthest in the discus on his way to his score of 6568.585. In the shot put, he finished thirteenth. In the discus throw, he only managed to come twenty-ninth in the regular discus throw, but came sixteenth in the two-handed discus. == See also == * Austria at the 1912 Summer Olympics == References == * Category:1891 births Category:Austrian decathletes Category:Austrian shot putters Category:Austrian male discus throwers Category:Olympic athletes of Austria Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1912 Summer Olympics Category:Year of death missing Category:Olympic decathletes
title: Josef Schäffer
